      • moveObject

        public static GraphicsUtils.MoveObjectResult moveObject(android.graphics.PointF objPosition,
                                                        android.graphics.RectF objBounds,
                                                        double speed,
                                                        double angleRadians,
                                                        double elapsedTime)
        Calculates the new position of a moving object
        Parameters:
        objPosition - The object's original position
        objBounds - The object's original bounding rectangle
        speed - The object's speed
        angleRadians - The object's direction angle
        elapsedTime - The time period over which the movement is calculated
        Returns:
        A MoveObjectResult containing the object's new position and bounding rectangle

      • moveObject

        public static GraphicsUtils.MoveObjectResult moveObject(android.graphics.PointF objPosition,
                                                        android.graphics.RectF objBounds,
                                                        double speed,
                                                        double angleCosine,
                                                        double angleSine,
                                                        double elapsedTime)
        Calculates the new position of a moving object
        Parameters:
        objPosition - The object's original position
        objBounds - The object's original bounding rectangle
        speed - The object's speed
        angleCosine - The cosine of the object's direction angle
        angleSine - The sine of the object's direction angle
        elapsedTime - The time period over which the movement is calculated
        Returns:
        A MoveObjectResult containing the object's new position and bounding rectangle

      • ricochetObject

        public static GraphicsUtils.RicochetObjectResult ricochetObject(android.graphics.PointF objPosition,
                                                                android.graphics.RectF objBounds,
                                                                double angleRadians,
                                                                float worldWidth,
                                                                float worldHeight)
        Ricochets an object off the edges of the world in order to keep the object from leaving the world. If the object is not at one of the world's edges, it does nothing. If the object is at one of the world's edges, it ricochets the object off the edge in order to prevent the object from leaving the world.
        Parameters:
        objPosition - The object's original position
        objBounds - The object's original bounding rectangle
        angleRadians - The object's direction angle
        worldWidth - The world's width
        worldHeight - The world's height
        Returns:
        A RicochetObjectResult containing the object's new position, bounding rectangle, and direction angle

      • ricochetObject

        public static GraphicsUtils.RicochetObjectResult ricochetObject(android.graphics.PointF objPosition,
                                                                android.graphics.RectF objBounds,
                                                                double angleRadians,
                                                                double angleCosine,
                                                                double angleSine,
                                                                float worldWidth,
                                                                float worldHeight)
        Ricochets an object off the edges of the world in order to keep the object from leaving the world. If the object is not at one of the world's edges, it does nothing. If the object is at one of the world's edges, it ricochets the object off the edge in order to prevent the object from leaving the world.
        Parameters:
        objPosition - The object's original position
        objBounds - The object's original bounding rectangle
        angleRadians - The object's direction angle
        angleCosine - The cosine of the object's direction angle
        angleSine - The sine of the object's direction angle
        worldWidth - The world's width
        worldHeight - The world's height
        Returns:
        A RicochetObjectResult containing the object's new position, bounding rectangle, and direction angle
